folder: Fulton Street & Bond Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Fulton Street, at the S.W. corner of Bond Street, showing an upright of the Fulton Street Elevated line of the B.M.T. on Fulton Street. The corner building was occupied in 1889, by Frederick Loeser and Co., a department store, still doing business at this location in 1937; from 1869-1889, they occupied the block bounded by Fulton, Washington, and Tillary Streets.

About 1900.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Bond Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Bond Street, east side, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Fulton Street. The view shows the home of Browning, King and Company, men's furnishers.

April 7, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Fulton Street & Bond Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Fulton St. adjoining n.e. corner Bond St., B'klyn.
May 13, 1942
P.L. Sperr, photographer
